intro: Verbena menthifolia var. comonduensis, commonly known as the Comondú verbena, is a perennial flowering plant native to the arid regions of Baja California, Mexico. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, mint-scented leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it well adapted to Mediterranean and semi-arid climates. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
